I know. I though hard and long about these.

In order to use this module standalone in another project you need to add following lines into your html file: 

        <script src="modules/authentication/authentication.js"></script>
        <script src="modules/authentication/controllers.js"></script>
        <script src="modules/authentication/services.js"></script>

Also you need to inject the dependency of 'Authentication' in your app module.

To define what pages should be protected and which shouldn't you can set an array of states in a config function like so:

        .config(function (authenticationProvider) {
            var exceptions = ['impressum','about'];
            authenticationProvider.setExceptions(exceptions);
        })

The template of this page is found in modules/authentication/authentication.html. To change the login algorithm have a look in modules/authentication/authentication.services.js inside the $scope.Login() function.
